abstract: Dark, hilarious, thrilling and bewildering, this Korean director is getting everyone’s attention.
lead_paragraph: Since winning the Palme d’Or at the Cannes Film Festival, “Parasite” has been a consensus favorite among critics, audiences and awards judges, and a coronation for its Korean director, Bong Joon Ho, who’s been a favorite in cinephile circles for years. But is there any consensus on what it is, exactly? Is it a thriller? A dark comedy? A family melodrama? A piece of social commentary? Even the meaning of the title is up for debate, perhaps recalling Bong’s earlier breakthrough, “The Host,” which was also perplexing when it was released in 2007.
